(l) There is hereby established a body corporate to be known as the Guyana Methodist Trust Corporation which shall consist of not less than four nor more than seven persons as hereinafter provided.  (2) Subject to this Act and to the Constitution and Discipline of the Church,  the  following  persons  shall  be  the  members  of  the Corporation, that  is  to  say, the  Reverend Donald Cedric Henry, President of the Conference, the Reverend Eric St. Claire Clarke, Secretary of the Conference, the Reverend Edwin Derick Fitzgerald Vandeyar, Chairman of the Guyana District, the Reverend George Newton  Frederick,  Secretary  of  the  Guyana  District  and  Harold Barrington Davis, Aubrey Ronald Fitz Bishop and Ella Barrow being three other members holding office in that behalf by virtue of their being  appointed thereto by the Committee, and their successors in office. type.name: section
type.title: Death or absence from Guyana of members of the Corporation.
type.context: GUYANA METHODIST TRUST CORPORATION ACT under Death or absence from Guyana of members of the Corporation. 4.  In the event of the death or absence from Guyana of any member of the Corporation, all or any of the powers conferred on the Corporation  by  this  Act  may  be  exercised  by  the  surviving  or remaining members, provided however, that such powers may not be exercised by less than four members of the Corporation.
type.description: In the event of the death or absence from Guyana of any member of the Corporation, all or any of the powers conferred on the Corporation  by  this  Act  may  be  exercised  by  the  surviving  or remaining members, provided however, that such powers may not be exercised by less than four members of the Corporation.

type.name: section
type.title: Tenure of membership.
type.context: GUYANA METHODIST TRUST CORPORATION ACT under Tenure of membership. 5.  A member shall continue in office until his tenure of office terminates in accordance with the Constitution and Discipline of the Church.
type.description: A member shall continue in office until his tenure of office terminates in accordance with the Constitution and Discipline of the Church.

type.name: section
type.title: Vesting of property in the Corporation.
type.context: GUYANA METHODIST TRUST CORPORATION ACT under Vesting of property in the Corporation. 6. All property in Guyana which before the commencement of this Act was vested in the Association and all property in Guyana to which the said Association is beneficially entitled shall be and the same are hereby vested, without further assurance, in the Corporation.
type.description: All property in Guyana which before the commencement of this Act was vested in the Association and all property in Guyana to which the said Association is beneficially entitled shall be and the same are hereby vested, without further assurance, in the Corporation.

type.context: GUYANA METHODIST TRUST CORPORATION ACT under Vesting of property bequeathed. 7. All property of whatever nature or kind hereafter bequeathed by will or otherwise acquired by the Church shall be deemed to be the property of the Corporation.
type.description: All property of whatever nature or kind hereafter bequeathed by will or otherwise acquired by the Church shall be deemed to be the property of the Corporation.

type.name: section
type.title: Evidence of acts.
type.context: GUYANA METHODIST TRUST CORPORATION ACT under Evidence of acts. 10.  Any person signing as Chairman, Secretary or member of the Corporation shall be taken so to be, until the contrary is proved, and any  statement or certificate that any person named therein is the Chairman, Secretary or member of the Corporation, or that a document is a true copy of any document or of any extract from any document or entry in the books or records of the Corporation purporting to be signed by the Chairman, the Secretary or a member shall be admissible as prima facie evidence of the fact of the original document or entry.
